sense.name: physical movement forward from a location
sense.examples: The general noted the enemy's advance to the outskirts of the city. The completed pass allowed the team's advance to the 10-yard line. The glacier's advance is measured in inches per year. The disease's advance to the liver implied it was terminal. (extended usage, implies a growing physical area)

sense.name: progress, improvement over time
sense.examples: The advance of civilization is a slow and painful process. He discussed some recent advances in cancer treatments. They are discouraged by the lack of advances in alternative energy technologies.

sense.name: a proposal, an overture
sense.examples: Mary tried to ignore John's romantic advances. Her advance of the idea at the last meeting was greeted with skepticism.

sense.name: money paid out prior to its actually being earned
sense.examples: The publisher gave the writer a $25,000 advance on the book. Several employees asked for an advance on next month's salary. The bank will give you an advance but charge 6 percent interest on it.

sense.name: an increase in price
sense.examples: There were advances all across the Big Board today. The dollar's recent advances against the euro have surprised investors.
